title: Oldboy (2003 film)
summary: Oldboy (Korean: 올드보이; RR: Oldeuboi; MR: Oldŭboi) is a 2003 South Korean neo-noir action thriller film[4][5] co-written by Park Chan-wook, Hwang Jo-yun, Lim Jun-hyung and directed by Park Chan-wook. It is loosely based on the Japanese manga of the same name. In the manga, the protagonist was detained for 10 years for the fact that he shed tears after listening to the villain's song as a child.
